p: The Asteraceae family (Compositae) is a widespread family of flowering plants, including 32,913 species names, belonging to 1,911 plant genera, distributed in 13 subfamilies [ 12]. The tropics, subtropics, and temperate regions are the natural habitats of Asteraceae species [ 13]. They usually contain a large amount of essential oil, polyphenols, and flavonoid compounds, which are often studied for antimicrobial and antioxidant activities [ 14â€“ 19].
